Job Position: Compliance / Data Analyst Officer

Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Procurement

About the Role


	Mopheth Group is seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Compliance / Data Officer to join our Procurement Department.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for enforcing compliance with internal policies, verifying procurement documentation, and conducting data analysis to support purchasing decisions.
	This role requires a strong eye for detail, a high level of integrity, and proficiency in Microsoft Excel.


Key Responsibilities


	Conduct regular compliance checks across procurement activities.
	Ensure all supplier invoices follow SOPs (timestamp, supplier name, verification with a green pen).
	Perform data analysis on procurement trends, costs, and inventory levels.
	Generate weekly reports highlighting fast-moving items and sales trends.
	Prevent overstocking/understocking through data-driven insights.
	Collaborate with Procurement, Accounts, and Internal Audit teams.
	Conduct training sessions on compliance protocols.


Requirements


	BSc in Statistics, Mathematics, Accounting, or any related discipline
	Minimum of 2&ndash;3 years of experience in compliance, data analysis, or procurement in the retail sector.
	Strong knowledge of procurement processes and SOPs.
	Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and data analysis tools.
	Excellent attention to detail and strong documentation skills.
	Strong interpersonal and communication abilities.
	Must be working in the retail sector


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@mophethgroup.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Compliance / Data Analyst Officer Job at Mopheth Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Mopheth Pharmaceutical Nigeria Limited is people and customer focused organization, we thrive to attain excellence and perfection at all times.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Compliance / Data Analyst Officer
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Procurement

About the Role
     

            
    




	Mopheth Group is seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Compliance / Data Officer to join our Procurement Department.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for enforcing compliance with internal policies, verifying procurement documentation, and conducting data analysis to support purchasing decisions.
	This role requires a strong eye for detail, a high level of integrity, and proficiency in Microsoft Excel.


Key Responsibilities


	Conduct regular compliance checks across procurement activities.
	Ensure all supplier invoices follow SOPs (timestamp, supplier name, verification with a green pen).
	Perform data analysis on procurement trends, costs, and inventory levels.
	Generate weekly reports highlighting fast-moving items and sales trends.
	Prevent overstocking/understocking through data-driven insights.
	Collaborate with Procurement, Accounts, and Internal Audit teams.
	Conduct training sessions on compliance protocols.


Requirements


	BSc in Statistics, Mathematics, Accounting, or any related discipline
	Minimum of 2–3 years of experience in compliance, data analysis, or procurement in the retail sector.
	Strong knowledge of procurement processes and SOPs.
	Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and data analysis tools.
	Excellent attention to detail and strong documentation skills.
	Strong interpersonal and communication abilities.
	Must be working in the retail sector


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@mophethgroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

        Mopheth Nigeria Limited, a leading player in the retail and supermarket industry, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer

Job Location: Ikate - Lekki, Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Support the procurement team in sourcing, negotiating, and purchasing goods and services.
	Process purchase orders and follow up with vendors to ensure timely delivery.
	Conduct basic market surveys to ensure competitive pricing.
	Assist in vendor management and maintaining supplier records.
	Ensure compliance with company procurement policies and procedures.
	Work closely with stores and accounts to resolve discrepancies.


Requirements
Education & Qualification:


	OND or HND in Business Administration, Procurement, Supply Chain Management, or related fields.


Experience:


	1 - 2 years of work experience in procurement or supply chain.
	Must currently be working in a supermarket environment with hands-on knowledge of retail procurement processes.
	Familiarity with QuickBooks or ERP systems is an added advantage.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong negotiation and communication skills.
	Attention to detail and organizational skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
	Team player with high integrity.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Application Letter and CV to: hr@mophethgroup.com using “Application – Procurement Officer” as the subject of the email.

Strategy &amp; Leadership:


	Define and execute the cloud and network engineering strategy and roadmap.

	Partner with enterprise engineering, security, and product leaders to ensure infrastructure scalability, reliability, and compliance.
	Lead modernization initiatives: software-defined networking (SDN), edge computing, zero trust networking, and cloud automation.


Cloud &amp; Infrastructure Management:


	Oversee design and management of IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS environments across public and private clouds.
	Govern infrastructure-as-code (Terraform, Ansible, CloudFormation) adoption.
	Ensure high availability, disaster recovery, and resilience across infrastructure services.
	Optimize cloud usage, costs, and performance through FinOps practices.


Network Engineering &amp; Operations:


	Lead the design and management of enterprise networks (LAN, WAN, SD-WAN, VPNs, firewalls, load balancers).
	Ensure secure, high-performance connectivity across data centers, branches, cloud, and edge locations.
	Drive adoption of next-generation networking technologies (5G, SDN, API-driven networking).
	Oversee monitoring, observability, and incident management for network performance.


Governance, Security &amp; Compliance:


	Partner with security teams to implement network and cloud security controls (zero trust, IAM, encryption, segmentation).
	Ensure compliance with regulatory and data protection standards across infrastructure and networks.
	Manage risk assessments, penetration tests, and remediation of vulnerabilities.
	Establish standards for access management, logging, and auditing.


Leadership &amp; People Development:


	Lead, mentor, and develop cloud engineers, network engineers, and infrastructure specialists.
	Foster a culture of automation, resilience, and continuous learning.
	Build talent pipelines for emerging cloud and network skills.
	Drive cross-team collaboration between DevOps, security, and software engineering.


Vendor &amp; Stakeholder Management:


	Manage relationships with cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP) and network vendors (Cisco, Palo Alto, VMware, etc.).
	Oversee contracts, service agreements, and vendor performance for cloud and networking services.
	Represent cloud &amp; network engineering in executive technology forums, architecture boards, and governance committees.


Qualifications
Education &amp; Certifications:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Networking, or related technical discipline (mandatory).
	Postgraduate qualification (MSc in IT/Networking/Cloud, MBA) &ndash; advantageous.
	Professional Certifications (preferred/required): AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Azure Solutions Architect, GCP Professional Cloud Architect; Cisco CCNP/CCIE, VMware NSX, Palo Alto Networks, Juniper certifications; Terraform, Kubernetes, Ansible; CISSP, CISM, or cloud security specialist certifications.


Experience:


	8&ndash;12 years of experience in cloud and network engineering, with at least 3&ndash;5 years in a leadership role.
	Proven experience in cloud migration, hybrid cloud operations, and enterprise-scale networking.
	Strong background in network security, zero trust architectures, and cloud security frameworks.
	Hands-on experience with SD-WAN, firewalls, VPNs, load balancers, and network observability tools.
	Track record of implementing infrastructure automation and cost optimization.
	Experience managing mission-critical infrastructure in regulated industries (banking, fintech, telecom, healthcare).


Core Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Deep expertise in cloud platforms, networking, and infrastructure automation.
	Strong leadership and mentoring skills for cloud and network teams.
	Excellent knowledge of governance, compliance, and cybersecurity.
	Strong vendor negotiation and management capabilities.
	Ability to balance innovation, operational stability, and cost efficiency.


Why You&rsquo;ll Enjoy It Here:


	Be Part of Something Big &ndash; A growing company where your contributions matter.
	Make an Immediate Impact &ndash; Support groundbreaking technologies with real-world results.
	Work on Cutting-Edge Tech &ndash; AI, cybersecurity, and next-gen digital solutions.
	Thrive in an Inclusive Team &ndash; A culture built on trust, collaboration, and respect.
	We Care &ndash; Integrity, empathy, and purpose guide every decision.
	We&rsquo;re looking for innovators, problem-solvers, and experts ready to drive change and grow with us.
